description: From Old French despreisier. Doublet of disprize.

verbs.description: dispraise (third-person singular simple present dispraises, present participle dispraising, simple past and past participle dispraised)

entries.meaning: To notice with disapprobation or some degree of censure; to disparage, to criticize.
examples: He became familiar with that habit of mind which dispraises what it most envies and admires: with that habit of mind which desires only what it cannot have.
